item.title: Machines the future workforce
item.dc:creator: pulsarforge
item.description:
Who will own the future workforce, "machines," and therefore the economy?

The post Machines the future workforce appeared first on PulsarForge.
item.content:encoded:
I was searching for IoT Blockchain projects a while ago, and I found IoteX

I was keeping an eye on the company and its projects. One morning, I woke up with hype for one new announcement they were going to launch,  Machinefi.

I quickly opened their vision paper and started to deep dive on it; what I discovered was way beyond impressive; it was eye-opening, their vision paper raised the question: 

Who will own the future workforce, “machines,” and therefore the economy?

Machines are already taking a significant part of work in different sectors, and this path is only going up, increasing year by year, some predictions:

  1. McKinsey: By 2030, machines will outnumber humans by 10:1 and generate 12 trillion dollars in economic value.
  2. PwC: 50% of all jobs will be partially automated by 2030.
  3. Deloitte: 30% of the world’s workers will be replaced entirely by machines within 20 years.

Beyond predictions, Machinefi’s vision, in a few words: break the status quo instead of corporations owning the world, therefore the machines; they enable people and communities to be drivers of this machine economy.

 

One more note: Remember, machines could be physical and / or digitals, with different levels of intelligence and acting over the real world and / or the digital world.

I invite you to read their vision paper.

The rise of MachineFi

If you enjoyed this chapter. Sharing is love.
